Description: FOR THE FY 23 NTHMP GRANT CYCLE, CNMI HSEM WILL IMPLEMENT ACTIVITIES THAT WILL NOT ONLY BUILD ON ITS CURRENT CAPABILITIES, BUT WILL ALSO ALLOW FOR THE COMPLETION OF PROJECTS INITIATED IN PREVIOUS GRANT AWARDS THAT WERE OTHERWISE HINDERED BY THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, AND ALSO BY THE DEVASTATING TYPHOONS THAT HAVE STRUCK OUR ISLANDS IN RECENT YEARS.

CALIFORNIA'S FY23 NOAA TSUNAMI GRANT ACTIVITIES GRANT PROPOSAL REQUESTS FUNDS TO EXPAND SUPPORT FOR THE TSUNAMIREADY  PROGRAM, AND TSUNAMI PREPAREDNESS ACTIVITIES. THE CALIFORNIA TSUNAMI PROGRAM PROPOSES TO WORK WITH MARITIME COMMUNITIES TO INCREASE PREPAREDNESS USING THE TSUNAMIREADY  CRITERIA AND LEVERAGE LARGE-SCALE EVENTS TO EXPAND THE PROGRAM'S AUDIENCE.

TO CONTINUE DEVELOPMENT OF TSUNAMI INUNDATION MAPS AND WARNING SYSTEMS, PROVIDE MITIGATION PRODUCTS THAT ADVANCE PREPAREDNESS, PROMOTE LOCAL- AND STATE-LEVEL TSUNAMI PLANNING THROUGH WORKSHOPS, AND IMPLEMENT A SUSTAINABLE EDUCATION-OUTREACH PROGRAM.

THE MAIN OBJECTIVE FOR THIS PROJECT IS TO CONTINUE THE DEVELOPMENT OF TSUNAMI INUNDATION MAPPING ACTIVITIES FOR THE GULF COAST (GC).  DURING THIS FY22, WE EXPECT TO COVER TWO NEW  URBAN AREAS: THE FIRST ONE, ALONG THE  STRIP BETWEEN -EAST OF DESTIN AND WEST OF PANAMA CITY-, FL (SPECIFICALLY, MIRAMAR BEACH TO ROSE MARY BEACH), AND THE SECOND, ALONG THE NORTH OF TAMPA, FL (HUDSON AND CLEARWATER). WE WILL USE 1/3 ARC-SECOND RESOLUTION DIGITAL ELEVATION MODELS (DEMS) FOR THE MAP DEVELOPMENT.

AS PART OF THE WASHINGTON STATE EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT DIVISION'S (WA EMD) HAZARDS AND OUTREACH SECTION, THE STATE'S TSUNAMI PROGRAM ULTIMATELY STRIVES TO ENABLE THE RECOGNITION, UNDERSTANDING, COMMUNICATION OF, AND PLANNING FOR TSUNAMI HAZARDS WHILE EMPOWERING INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES TO MAKE THE INFORMED RISK MANAGEMENT DECISIONS NECESSARY FOR ADAPTING TO, WITHSTANDING, AND QUICKLY RECOVERING FROM TSUNAMI HAZARD INCIDENTS (AKA BUILDING COMMUNITY RESILIENCE).

VITEMA PLANS TO ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING TASKS WITH FY22 FUNDING:  1. NTHMP & DELEGATION MEETING TRAVEL 2. PROGRAM COORDINATOR SALARY/SUPPLIES 3. CONDUCT TSUNAMI EXERCISES/ENSURE TSUNAMI MODELING/CREATION OF TOOLKITS 4. PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENTS & TSUNAMI AWARENESS COMMERCIAL 5. REPRODUCTION OF EDUCATIONAL /OUTREACH MATERIALS

THE GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO MAINTAIN AND STRENGTHEN THE TSUNAMI PREPAREDNESS LEVEL IN PUERTO RICO, EMPHASIZING THE SUPPORT TO THE COMMUNITIES TO RENEW THEIR TSUNAMIREADY RECOGNITION AND THE TSUNAMIREADY SUPPORTERS PROGRAM.   PROPOSED TASKS: 1. TSUNAMIREADY AND TSUNAMIREADY SUPPORTER PROGRAMS IMPLEMENTATION AND MAINTENANCE. 2. THREAT AND HAZARD ASSESSMENTS 3. NTHMP SUPPORT TO COORDINATING COMMITTEE, SUBCOMMITTEES, AND RELATED TRAVEL   4. CREATING A COMMUNITY-BASED CULTURE OF TSUNAMI PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE. 5. SOCIAL SCIENCES COMPONENT 6. COLLABORATIVE PROJECTS.

THE FOLLOWING TASKS ARE PLANNED FOR OREGON'S FY22 GRANT: 1. PARTICIPATION IN NTHMP 2. INCREASE PREPAREDNESS THROUGH OUTREACH AND EDUCATION 3. OPTIMIZE SAFE EVACUATION FOR LOCAL TSUNAMIS 4. COMMUNITY RISK AND EXPOSURE ANALYSES 5. MARITIME GUIDANCE MODELING 6. VERTICAL EVACUATION STRUCTURE MODELING 7. CASCADIA SOURCE WORKSHOP SUMMARY

THE FOLLOWING TECHNICAL WORK PACKAGES ARE PROPOSED FOR US EAST COAST (USEC) FY22 TASKS:  IDENTIFY AND MAP POPULATION, PROPERTY AND CRITICAL FACILITIES IN RELATION TO HIGH HAZARD COUNTIES UTILIZING 2ND GENERATION HAZARD MAPS AND FEMA'S HAZUS DATA TO THE EXTENT PRACTICABLE.  WORK TO MAKE HAZUS OPERABLE FOR USEC STATES.   DEVELOP LOCAL HAZARD MAPS (2ND-GENERATION WITH ENHANCED PRODUCTS) FOR 2 IDENTIFIED HIGHEST HAZARD COUNTIES FOCUSING ON COMPLETING WHOLE STATES.   PERFORM A PROBABILISTIC LANDSLIDE TSUNAMI (PTHA) SOURCE SELECTION AND MODELING FOR VARIOUS RETURN PERIODS FOR THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES OF THE USEC.  WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH GULF OF MEXICO (GOM) TO UNIFY TSUNAMI INUNDATION MAPS IN FLORIDA (FORMAT, RESOLUTION AND FINAL PRESENTATION).  IN ADDITION ONE MMS SUPPORTED TECHNICAL ACTIVITY IS PROPOSED FOR FY22 TASKS: BASED ON RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE 2019 USGS POWELL CENTER MEETING, CONTINUATION (I.E., FINE-TUNING AND REFINEMENT) OF THE DEVELOPMENT OF A GENERIC METHODOLOGY

THE PRIMARY GOAL OF HI-EMA'S COMPREHENSIVE TSUNAMI PROGRAM IS TO PLAN FOR AND MITIGATE THE IMPACTS OF A TSUNAMI BY: 1) CREATING AWARENESS IN ALL COMMUNITIES OF THE POTENTIALLY DESTRUCTIVE EFFECTS OF A TSUNAMI, WITH AN EMPHASIS OF TARGETING SOME OF OUR MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS. 2) EDUCATION AND OUTREACH EFFORTS UTILIZING BEST-PRACTICES.  3) ONGOING EFFORTS TO MODEL AND ANALYZE TSUNAMI THREATS STATEWIDE.   IT IS ALSO HI-EMA'S ROLE TO COLLABORATE WITH THE NTHMP; PACIFIC TSUNAMI WARNING CENTER; THE UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII; OTHER GOVERNMENT AGENCIES; COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS; AND LOCAL RADIO STATIONS TO ENCOURAGE TSUNAMI PREPAREDNESS AND TO PROMOTE TSUNAMI RESILIENCE THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THE PROPOSED TASKS WILL SUPPORT HI-EMA'S EFFORT TO MITIGATE THE IMPACTS OF A TSUNAMI.

THE GUAM TSUNAMI PROGRAM, UNDER THE PURVIEW OF GUAM HOMELAND SECURITY/OFFICE OF CIVIL DEFENSE, IS A VEHICLE OF THE AGENCY'S COMMITMENT TO ENSURE THE ISLAND'S PREPAREDNESS FOR TSUNAMI EVENTS.  FOR THE PAST SEVERAL YEARS THE TSUNAMI PROGRAM HAS ENHANCED GUAM'S EFFORTS FOR EDUCATION, AWARENESS, PREPARATIONS AND RESPONSE TO CAUSES SURROUNDING THE ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT THAT THE NATIONAL TSUNAMI HAZARD MITIGATION PROGRAM PROVIDES.

CALIFORNIA'S FY22 NOAA TSUNAMI GRANT ACTIVITIES GRANT PROPOSAL REQUESTS FUNDS FOR THE STATE'S RESOURCES AND PARTICIPATION IN THE TSUNAMIREADY  PROGRAM, AND TSUNAMI PREPAREDNESS ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED THROUGHOUT THE FISCAL YEAR.  THE CALIFORNIA TSUNAMI PROGRAM PROPOSES TO CONDUCT A TSUNAMI "ROAD SHOW" AS A PILOT-PROGRAM AT A MINIMUM OF TWO (2) LOCATIONS TO INCREASE PUBLIC EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES AND CREATE ADDITIONAL POTENTIAL TO EXPAND TSUNAMIREADY .

THIS PROPOSAL PROVIDES A SYSTEMATIC APPROACH THAT WILL ENABLE AMERICAN SAMOA TO ACQUIRE OR PROCURE THE MEANS TO SUSTAIN AND UPGRADE, AS APPLICABLE, THE PREPARATION LEVEL OF ITS PEOPLE FOR FUTURE TSUNAMI THREATS. THESE PROJECTS AND EFFORTS BY THE AMERICAN SAMOA TSUNAMI PROGRAM ARE VITAL TO MEETING ITS ULTIMATE GOAL TOWARD THE PREVENTION OR MINIMIZATION OF THE LOSS OF LIFE AND TO MITIGATE THE DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY AND THE OVERALL ENVIRONMENT FROM ANOTHER TSUNAMI THREAT.

TO CONTINUE DEVELOPMENT OF TSUNAMI INUNDATION MAPS AND WARNING SYSTEMS, PROVIDE MITIGATION PRODUCTS THAT ADVANCE PREPAREDNESS, PROMOTE LOCAL- AND STATE-LEVEL TSUNAMI PLANNING THROUGH WORKSHOPS, AND IMPLEMENT A SUSTAINABLE EDUCATION-OUTREACH PROGRAM TO SUPPORT THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE'S TSUNAMIREADY PROGRAM. THIS PROPOSAL SUPPORTS THE PRIMARY GOAL OF MITIGATING THE IMPACT OF TSUNAMIS THROUGH PUBLIC EDUCATION, COMMUNITY RESPONSE PLANNING, AND ACCURATE HAZARD ASSESSMENT.

THE CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT (CDDRR) FOR WEATHER, WATER, AND CLIMATE FORECASTING AND DISASTER RISK REDUCTION PROGRAM'S GOAL IS TO IMPROVE THE PERFORMANCE OF ALL OPERATIONAL METEOROLOGICAL HYDROLOGICAL, AND DISASTER/EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT SERVICES WORLDWIDE. IMPROVING AGENCIES' PERFORMANCE FOR ENHANCED DECISION SUPPORT SERVICES IS DONE THROUGH COLLABORATION BETWEEN OPERATIONAL HYDROLOGISTS/METEOROLOGISTS, SCIENTISTS, AND OTHER STAFF WITH EXPERTISE ACROSS A WIDE RANGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL, ECONOMIC, AND SOCIAL AND BEHAVIORAL SCIENCES. THESE ACTIVITIES ENGAGE OPERATIONAL HYDROLOGISTS, METEOROLOGISTS, AND RESEARCHERS IN DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF INNOVATIVE PROGRAMS WHICH ARE PIVOTAL TO THE IMPROVEMENT OF WEATHER AND CLIMATE EARLY WARNING SERVICES IN DEVELOPING COUNTRIES.     THE OBJECTIVES OF THE CDDRR FOR WEATHER READY NATIONS, GLOBAL FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE PROGRAMS AND HYDROMETEOROLOGICAL HAZARDS EARLY WARNING SYSTEMS PROGRAM (IPS) ARE TO SUPPORT CAPACITY BUILDING IN DEVELOPING AND LEAST DE

THE ETCD PROGRAM'S GOAL IS TO IMPROVE PERFORMANCE OF ALL OPERATIONAL METEOROLOGISTS AND HYDROLOGISTS WORLDWIDE. IMPROVING HUMAN PERFORMANCE FOR ENHANCED DECISION SUPPORT SERVICES IS DONE THROUGH COLLABORATIVE TRAINING AND EDUCATION. ETCD IS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH COLLABORATION BETWEEN OPERATIONAL HYDROLOGISTS/METEOROLOGISTS, SCIENTISTS, AND ACADEMIC STAFF WITH EXPERTISE ACROSS A WIDE RANGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL, EDUCATIONAL, AND SOCIAL AND BEHAVIORAL SCIENCES. THESE ACTIVITIES ENGAGE OPERATIONAL HYDROLOGISTS, METEOROLOGISTS, RESEARCHERS, INSTRUCTORS, AND STUDENTS IN APPLIED TRAINING AND SIMULATION EXERCISES WHICH ARE PIVOTAL TO THE OPERATIONAL CLIMATE, WATER, AND WEATHER COMMUNITIES. THE GOAL OF IMPROVING PERFORMANCE IS ACHIEVED THROUGH A COMPETENCY-BASED EDUCATION AND TRAINING PROGRAM. BY MEETING THE GOAL OF ETCD, FORECASTS AND WARNINGS OF ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS WILL BE IMPROVED.
